strategy: Replace the neural network architecture with a Gaussian Mixture Model (GMM)-based policy that models action distributions as a mixture of Gaussian components. Each Gaussian component is parameterized by a learned mean and covariance matrix, and the mixture weights are learned jointly with the policy. Use state features extracted via a simple 1D convolutional layer to capture local dynamics, and apply online clustering of states during training to adaptively refine the mixture components. This approach enables the policy to learn discrete yet flexible action modes tailored to different regions of the state space, improving exploration and reward accumulation in the MountainCarContinuous environment.

    """Instantiate a model according to obs shape of environment."""
    # Get number of desired output units
